ikapman, get them from ms download center like I do. You don't want to install too many unnecessary kb files if you can help it. Most of the files are small, and there are a lot of them typically for each kb file.  The actual size of the kb files does not hurt much, but processing a bunch of small files does. Try to copy over a few thousand small files to a flash drive and you'll see the difference between one big file and tons of small files.

Anyway, the method is pretty straightforward... I just install a fresh copy of an OS on a VM and check wuapp for the kb files that windows update tries to download. I then download all of those kb files from MS download center and stash them in a folder.

I mount the index, add-package the msu files, copy over a few other things like the activation script and files, and then unmount and commit changes.

There is no advantage in me posting the files since they are readily available from Microsoft. I do the integration work on a regular basis because it's a bit more complicated than most people are used to working with.

More than a few people have PM'd me on MDL asking questions about integration or why they can't get something to work right. You are also welcome to do so. It is my hobby after all.
